sect2.title: HTTPSender
sect2.para: The HTTPSender can be used to send messages via HTTP protocol using POST method as default to the URL specified by the 'target' property. The HTTP method can be changed using the method property.

The various scenarios can lead to a different HTTP response codes that are expected. The scenario can be set to expect one or more response codes. It can be set via expectedResponseCodes property. Default expected response code is 200.
To set headers of the HTTP request use the header element of the particular message element in the messages section of the scenario definition.

Following table shows the properties of the HTTPSender:
HTTPSender properties
Property name Description Required Default value
target URL of the target, where the message is send. Yes -
expectedResponseCodes A comma separated list of HTTP response code(s) that is expected to be returned.
No "200"
method
HTTP method to be used.
See
for a complete list of available methods.
No "POST"

simplesect.title: Example of HTTPSender configuration
simplesect.programlisting: ... <sender class="HTTPSender"> <property name="target" value="http://domain.com/cool-url"/> <property name="method" value="GET"/> <property name="expectedResponseCodes" value="200,202"/> </sender> ...
